vulnerability_location.description: External call (_addr.call.value) is made before updating the Holders mapping, allowing reentrant calls to drain funds
The function 'initTokenBank' is intended as a constructor but is a public method without any onlyOwner guard, allowing anyone to reinitialize the contract state (reset owner and MinDeposit).
Unchecked addition in Holders[msg.sender] += msg.value, potential integer overflow without SafeMath
Low-level calls using .call() are made without checking their returned boolean values, allowing silent failures

The function initTokenBank is intended as a constructor but is a public function in Solidity 0.4.18. Anyone can call it to reset the owner and MinDeposit, leading to unauthorized takeover and reinitialization.
